intro: Geraniospermum hirtum, commonly known as the hairy geraniospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and often hairy foliage. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a distinctive, rough texture. Geraniospermum hirtum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
